data.title: WHO launches global initiative to reduce suicide rates by 2030
data.snippet: The World Health Organization's new LIVE LIFE framework targets a one-third reduction in global suicide rates through evidence-based interventions.

data.title: Social media platforms under fire for algorithm-driven self-harm content
data.snippet: Research shows TikTok and Instagram algorithms can lead vulnerable teens to self-harm content within minutes of creating a new account.

data.title: Japan's suicide prevention hotline reports 40% increase in calls from young adults
data.snippet: Mental health experts attribute the rise to economic anxiety, social isolation, and the pressures of an increasingly digital society.

data.title: India records concerning rise in student suicides linked to exam pressure
data.snippet: NCRB data shows a 15% increase in student suicides, with competitive exam pressure cited as a leading contributing factor.

data.title: Pinterest deploys AI to detect and redirect self-harm searches to crisis resources
data.snippet: Pinterest's compassionate search feature now covers 14 languages and redirects users searching for self-harm content to local helplines.
